chain.description: Choose which network / blockchain to use.

chain.name: Chain
chain.description: Choose which network / blockchain to use.

testnet.name: Use Testnet
testnet.shortDescription: Run this node on the testnet3 chain. Equivalent to -chain=test.
testnet.description: Use the testnet3 chain. Equivalent to -chain=test. Support for testnet3 is deprecated and will be removed in an upcoming release. Consider moving to testnet4 now by using -testnet4.

testnet4.name: Use Testnet 4
testnet4.description: Use the testnet4 chain. Equivalent to -chain=testnet4.

regtest.name: Regtest
regtest.shortDescription: Run this node on its own independent test network. Equivalent to -chain=regtest.
regtest.description: Enter regression test mode, which uses a special chain in which blocks can be solved instantly. This is intended for regression testing tools and app development. Equivalent to -chain=regtest.

signet.name: Signet
signet.description: Use the signet chain. Equivalent to -chain=signet. Note that the network is defined by the -signetchallenge parameter

signetchallenge.name: Signet Challenge
signetchallenge.shortDescription: Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for signet networks).
signetchallenge.description: Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for signet networks; defaults to the global default signet test network challenge).

signetblocktime.name: Signet Blocktime
signetblocktime.shortDescription: Difficulty adjustment will target a block time of the given amount in seconds (must have -signetchallenge set).
signetblocktime.description: Difficulty adjustmnt will target a block time of the given amount in seconds (only for custom signet networks, must have -signetchallenge set; defaults to 10 minutes).

signetseednode.name: Signet Seed Node
signetseednode.shortDescription: Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port] format, e.g. sig.net:1234 (may be used multiple times to specify multiple seed nodes).
signetseednode.description: Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port] format, e.g. sig.net:1234 (may be used multiple times to specify multiple seed nodes; defaults to the global default signet test network seed node(s)).

vbparams.name: Version Bits Deployment Params
vbparams.description: Use given start/end times for specified version bits deployment. Regtest mode only, in format <deployment:start:end[:min_activation_height]>. Can be set multiple times.

core.description: Basic parameters regarding Bitcoin Knots node operation.

alertnotify.name: Alert Notification
alertnotify.description: Execute command when an alert (or long fork) is received (%s in cmd is replaced by message)

blockfilterindex.name: Block Filter Index
blockfilterindex.description: Maintain an index of compact filters by block. If set to 1, certain indexes are enabled (currently just basic).

valueDescriptions.1: Certain indexes are enabled (currently just basic).

blocknotify.name: Block Notification
blocknotify.description: Execute command when the best block changes (%s in cmd is replaced by block hash)

blocksdir.name: Block Data Storage Location
blocksdir.description: Specify a non-default location to store blockchain data.

blocksxor.name: Blocks Data XOR
blocksxor.shortDescription: Whether an XOR-key applies to blocksdir *.dat files.
blocksxor.description: Whether an XOR-key applies to blocksdir *.dat files. The created XOR-key will be zeros for an existing blocksdir or when `-blocksxor=0` is set, and random for a freshly initialized blocksdir.

blocksonly.name: Blocks Only Mode
blocksonly.shortDescription: Only download and relay blocks - ignore unconfirmed transactions.
blocksonly.description: Whether to reject unconfirmed transactions from network peers. Disables automatic broadcast and rebroadcast of transactions, unless the source peer has the 'forcerelay' permission. RPC transactions are not affected.

assumevalid.name: Assume Valid Chain History
assumevalid.shortDescription: If this block is in the chain assume that it and its ancestors are valid and potentially skip their script verification.
assumevalid.description:
If this block is in the chain assume that it and its ancestors are valid and potentially skip their script verification (performance boost during initial sync). Set to 0 to verify all blocks.
default:
000000000000000000006e926737e6a349f7581525ad36e743dfe5f4bc3abbb7
testnet3:
000000000000000465b1a66c9f386308e8c75acef9201f3f577811da09fc90ad
testnet4:
000000005be348057db991fa5d89fe7c4695b667cfb311391a8db374b6f681fd
signet:
0000014aad1d58dddcb964dd749b073374c6306e716b22f573a2efe68d414539.

coinstatsindex.name: Coin Stats Index
coinstatsindex.description: Maintain coinstats index used by the gettxoutsetinfo RPC.

daemon.name: Daemon Mode
daemon.description: Run in the background as a daemon and accept commands.

daemonwait.name: Daemon Wait Mode
daemonwait.description: Wait for initialization to be finished before exiting. This implies -daemon.

datadir.name: Data Storage Location
datadir.description: Specify a non-default location to store blockchain and other data.

dbbatchsize.name: DB Batch Size
dbbatchsize.description: Maximum database write batch size in bytes.

dbcache.name: DB Cache Size
dbcache.shortDescription: Set database cache size in MiB (4 to 1048576).
dbcache.description: Set database cache size in MiB (4 to 1048576). Machines sync faster with a larger cache. In addition, unused mempool memory is shared for this cache (see -maxmempool).

dbfilesize.name: DB File Size
dbfilesize.description: Target size of files within databases, in MiB.

lowmem.name: Low Memory
lowmem.description: If system available memory falls below <n> MiB, flush caches.

confrw.name: Include Read/Write Config File
confrw.description: Specify path to read/write configuration file. Relative paths will be prefixed by the network-specific datadir location.

includeconf.name: Include Additional Config File
includeconf.description: Load additional configuration file, relative to the datadir path.

allowignoredconf.name: Allow Ignored Config File
allowignoredconf.description: For backwards compatibility, treat an unused bitcoin.conf file in the datadir as a warning, not an error.

loadblock.name: Import Blocks From File
loadblock.description: Imports blocks from external blk000??.dat file on startup. This option can be set multiple times with different file values.

maxorphantx.name: Max Orphan Transactions
maxorphantx.description: Keep at most <n> unconnectable transactions in memory.

maxmempool.name: Max Mempool Size
maxmempool.description: Keep the transaction memory pool below <n> megabytes.

mempoolexpiry.name: Mempool Expiration
mempoolexpiry.description: Do not keep transactions in the mempool longer than <n> hours.

minimumchainwork.name: Minimum Chain Work
minimumchainwork.shortDescription: Minimum work assumed to exist on a valid chain in hex.

persistmempool.name: Persist Mempool
persistmempool.description: Save the mempool on shutdown and load on restart.

persistmempoolv1.name: Persist Mempool v1
persistmempoolv1.shortDescription: Whether a mempool.dat file created by -persistmempool or the savemempool RPC will be written in the legacy format (version 1) or the current format (version 2).
persistmempoolv1.description: Whether a mempool.dat file created by -persistmempool or the savemempool RPC will be written in the legacy format (version 1) or the current format (version 2). This temporary option will be removed in the future.

blockreconstructionextratxn.name: Block Reconstruction Transactions
blockreconstructionextratxn.description: Extra transactions to keep in memory for compact block reconstructions.

par.name: Script Verification Parallelization
par.description: Set the number of script verification threads. (1 up to 15, 0 = automatic, less than 0 = leave that many cores free).

pid.name: PID file
pid.description: Specify process ID file name. Relative paths will be prefixed by a net-specific datadir location.

prune.name: Prune Old Blocks
prune.shortDescription: Reduce storage requirements by enabling pruning (deleting) of old blocks.
prune.description: Reduce storage requirements by enabling pruning (deleting) of old blocks. This allows the pruneblockchain RPC to be called to delete specific blocks and enables automatic pruning of old blocks if a target size in MiB is provided. This mode is incompatible with -txindex and -coinstatsindex. WARNING: Reverting this setting requires re-downloading the entire blockchain. (default: 0 = disable pruning blocks, 1 = allow manual pruning via RPC, greater than 550 = automatically prune blocks to stay under target size in MiB).

pruneduringinit.name: Prune During Init
pruneduringinit.shortDescription: Temporarily adjusts the -prune setting until initial sync completes.
pruneduringinit.description: Temporarily adjusts the -prune setting until initial sync completes. Ignored if pruning is disabled. (default: -1 = same value as -prune).

reindex-chainstate.name: Reindex Chainstate
reindex-chainstate.shortDescription: Reindex chain state from the currently indexed blocks.
reindex-chainstate.description: Reindex chain state from the currently indexed blocks. WARNING: very slow!

reindex.name: Reindex
reindex.shortDescription: Rebuild chain state and block index from the blk*.dat files on disk.
reindex.description: Rebuild chain state and block index from the blk*.dat files on disk. If an assumeutxo snapshot was loaded, its chainstate will be wiped as well. The snapshot can then be reloaded via RPC. WARNING: very slow!

settings.name: Settings Data File
settings.description: Specify path to dynamic settings data file. Can be disabled with -nosettings. File is written at runtime and not meant to be edited by users (use bitcoin.conf instead for custom settings). Relative paths will be prefixed by datadir location.

shutdownnotify.name: Shutdown Notification
shutdownnotify.shortDescription: Execute command immediately before beginning shutdown.
shutdownnotify.description: Execute command immediately before beginning shutdown. The need for shutdown may be urgent, so be careful not to delay it long (if the command doesn't require interaction with the server, consider having it fork into the background).

softwareexpiry.name: Software Expiry
softwareexpiry.description: Stop working after this POSIX timestamp.

txindex.name: Index Transactions
txindex.description: Maintain a full transaction index, used by the getrawtransaction rpc call.

debug.description: Features that help developers who are testing changes to Bitcoin Knots.

uacomment.name: User Agent Comment
uacomment.description: Append comment to the user agent string.

acceptstalefeeestimates.name: Accept Stale Fee Estimates
acceptstalefeeestimates.shortDescription: Read fee estimates even if they are over 60 hours old. Regtest only.
acceptstalefeeestimates.description: Read fee estimates even if they are stale (regtest only) fee estimates are considered stale if they are 60 hours old.

capturemessages.name: Capture Messages
capturemessages.description: Capture all P2P messages to disk.

checkblockindex.name: Check Block Index
checkblockindex.shortDescription: Do a consistency check for the block tree, chainstate, and other validation data structures every <n> operations.
checkblockindex.description: Do a consistency check for the block tree, chainstate, and other validation data structures every <n> operations. Use 0 to disable. (default: 0, regtest: 1).

checkblocks.name: Check Blocks
checkblocks.shortDescription: How many recent blocks to check at startup (0 == check all blocks).
checkblocks.description: How many recent blocks to check at startup. (0 == check all blocks which is very slow!)

checklevel.name: Check Block Level
checklevel.shortDescription: How thorough the block verification of -checkblocks is (0-4).
checklevel.description: How thorough the block verification of -checkblocks is: level 0 reads the blocks from disk, level 1 verifies block validity, level 2 verifies undo data, level 3 checks disconnection of tip blocks, level 4 tries to reconnect the blocks, each level includes the checks of the previous levels.

checkaddrman.name: Check Address Manager
checkaddrman.description: Run addrman consistency checks every <n> operations.

checkmempool.name: Check Mempool
checkmempool.description: Run mempool consistency checks every <n> transactions. Use 0 to disable (default: 0, regtest: 1).

checkpoints.name: Enable Checkpoints
checkpoints.description: Enable rejection of any forks from the known historical chain until block 885248.

dbcrashratio.name: DB Crash Ratio
dbcrashratio.description: Randomly crash while writing data at a given rate between 0 and 1.

fastprune.name: Fast Prune
fastprune.description: Use smaller block files and lower minimum prune height for testing purposes.

stopafterblockimport.name: Stop After Block Import
stopafterblockimport.description: Stop running after importing blocks from disk.

stopatheight.name: Stop At Height
stopatheight.description: Stop running after reaching the given height in the main chain.

test.name: Test-Only Option
test.description: Pass a test-only option. Options include: addrman (use deterministic addrman).

testactivationheight.name: Test Activation Height
testactivationheight.description: Set the activation height of of 'name' (segwit, bip34, dersig, cltv, csv) via 'name@height' (regtest-only).

limitancestorcount.name: Limit Transaction Ancestor Count
limitancestorcount.description: Do not accept transactions if number of in-mempool ancestors is <n> or more.

limitancestorsize.name: Limit Transaction Ancestor Size
limitancestorsize.description: Do not accept transactions whose size with all in-mempool ancestors exceeds <n> kilobytes.

limitdescendantcount.name: Limit Transaction Descendant Count
limitdescendantcount.description: Do not accept transactions if any ancestor would have <n> or more in-mempool descendants.

limitdescendantsize.name: Limit Transaction Descendant Size
limitdescendantsize.description: Do not accept transactions if any ancestor would have more than <n> kilobytes of in-mempool descendants.

debug.name: Debug Logging
debug.description: Output debug and trace logging. If set to 1 or "all", output for all categories. If set to 0 or "none", disable for all categories. This option can be specified multiple times to output multiple categories.

valueDescriptions.all: Enable debug logging for all categories.

debugexclude.name: Exclude Debug Logging
debugexclude.description: Exclude debug and trace logging for a category. Can be used in conjunction with -debug=1 to output debug and trace logging for all categories except the specified category. This option can be specified multiple times to exclude multiple categories. This takes priority over "-debug".

debuglogfile.name: Debug Log File
debuglogfile.description: Specify location of debug log file. Relative paths will be prefixed by a net-specific datadir location. Pass -nodebuglogfile to disable writing the log to a file.

logips.name: Log IP Addresses
logips.description: Include IP addresses in debug output.

loglevel.name: Log Level
loglevel.shortDescription: Set the global or per-category severity level for logging in the format of either <level> or <category>:<level>. Level values may be: info, debug, or trace. Format <category>:<level> may be specified multiple times.
loglevel.description: Set the global or per-category severity level for logging categories enabled with the -debug configuration option or the logging RPC in the format or either <level> or <category>:<level>. Possible values for level are info, debug, trace (default=debug). The following levels are always logged: error, warning, info. If <category>:<level> is supplied, the setting will override the global one and may be specified multiple times to set multiple category-specific levels. See '-debug' config for allowed category values.

loglevelalways.name: Log Level Always
loglevelalways.description: Always prepend a category and level.

logsourcelocations.name: Log Source Locations
logsourcelocations.description: Prepend debug output with name of the originating source location (source file, line number and function name).

logthreadnames.name: Log Thread Names
logthreadnames.description: Prepend debug output with name of the originating thread.

logtimemicros.name: Log Precise Timestamps
logtimemicros.description: Add microsecond precision to debug timestamps.

mocktime.name: Mock Timestamps
mocktime.description: Replace actual time with <n> seconds since epoch.

maxsigcachesize.name: Max Signature Cache Size
maxsigcachesize.description: Limit sum of signature cache and script execution cache sizes to <n> MiB.

maxtipage.name: Max Age of Chain Tip
maxtipage.description: Maximum tip age in seconds to consider node in initial block download.

maxtxfee.name: Max Transaction Fee
maxtxfee.shortDescription: Maximum total fees (in BTC) to use in a single wallet transaction or raw transaction.
maxtxfee.description: Maximum total fees (in BTC) to use in a single wallet transaction or raw transaction; setting this too low may abort large transactions.

printtoconsole.name: Output to Console
printtoconsole.description: Send trace/debug info to console (default: 1 when no -daemon. To disable logging to file, set -nodebuglogfile)

printpriority.name: Print Priority
printpriority.description: Log transaction priority and fee rate in BTC/kvB when mining blocks.

promiscuousmempoolflags.name: Script Verification Flags
promiscuousmempoolflags.description: Integer representing the script verification flags to enable (all ORed together) - flags can be found in interpreter.h.

shrinkdebugfile.name: Shrink Debug Log File
shrinkdebugfile.description: Shrink debug.log file on client startup (default: 1 when no -debug).

relay.description: Fine tune settings for what transactions your node will relay to peers.

acceptnonstddatacarrier.name: Accept Non-Standard Datacarrier Transactions
acceptnonstddatacarrier.description: Relay and mine non-OP_RETURN datacarrier injection.

minrelaytxfee.name: Min Transaction Relay Fee
minrelaytxfee.description: Fee rates (in BTC/kB) smaller than this are considered zero fee for relaying, mining and transaction creation.

incrementalrelayfee.name: Incremental Relay Fee
incrementalrelayfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) used to define cost of relay, used for mempool limiting and replacement policy.

dustrelayfee.name: Dust Relay Fee
dustrelayfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) used to defined dust, the value of an output such that it will cost about 1/3 of its value in fees at this fee rate to spend it.

dustdynamic.name: Dynamic Dust Relay Fee
dustdynamic.description: Automatically raise dustrelayfee based on either the expected fee to be mined within <blocks> blocks, or to be within the best <kvB> kvB of this node's mempool. Specify in format: off|[<multiplier>*]target:<blocks>|[<multiplier>*]mempool:<kvB>. If unspecified, multiplier is 3.

bytespersigop.name: Bytes Per Signature Operation
bytespersigop.description: Equivalent bytes per sigop in transactions for relay and mining.

bytespersigopstrict.name: Bytes Per Signature Operation Strict
bytespersigopstrict.description: Minimum bytes per sigop in transactions we relay and mine.

datacarrier.name: Data Carrier
datacarrier.description: Relay and mine data carrier transactions.

datacarriersize.name: Data Carrier Size
datacarriersize.description: Maximum size of data in data carrier transactions we relay and mine, in bytes.

datacarriercost.name: Data Carrier Cost
datacarriercost.description: Treat extra data in transactions as at least N vbytes per actual byte.

datacarrierfullcount.name: Data Carrier Full Count
datacarrierfullcount.description: Apply datacarriersize limit to all known datacarrier methods.

permitbaremultisig.name: Permit Bare Multisig
permitbaremultisig.description: Relay transactions creating non-P2SH multisig outputs.

rejectparasites.name: Reject Parasites
rejectparasites.description: Refuse to relay or mine parasitic overlay protocols.

rejecttokens.name: Reject Tokens
rejecttokens.description: Refuse to relay or mine transactions involving non-bitcoin tokens.

maxscriptsize.name: Maximum Script Size
maxscriptsize.description: Maximum size of scripts we relay and mine, in bytes.

spkreuse.name: Script And Public Key Reuse
spkreuse.description: Set to "allow" to relay/mine transactions reusing addresses or other pubkey scripts, or "conflict" to treat them as exclusive prior to being mined.

valueDescriptions.allow: Relay/mine transactions reusing addresses or other pubkey scripts.
valueDescriptions.conflict: Treat transactions reusing addresses or other pubkey scripts as exclusive prior to being mined.

mempoolfullrbf.name: Mempool Full RBF
mempoolfullrbf.description: Accept transaction replace-by-fee without requiring replaceability signaling.

mempooltruc.name: Mempool Topologically Restricted Until Confirmation (TRUC) Policy
mempooltruc.description: Behaviour for transactions requesting TRUC limits: "reject" the transactions entirely, "accept" them just like any other, or "enforce" to impose their requested restrictions.

valueDescriptions.accept: Accept TRUC transactions just like any other.

whitelistrelay.name: Whitelist Relay
whitelistrelay.description: Add 'relay' permission to whitelisted peers with default permissions. This will accept relayed transactions even when not relaying transactions.

whitelistforcerelay.name: Whitelist Force Relay
whitelistforcerelay.description: Add 'forcerelay' permission to whitelisted peers with default permissions. This will relay transactions even if the transactions were already in the mempool.

network.description: Options for how your node interacts with other peers on the network.

addnode.name: Connect to Peer
addnode.shortDescription: Add a node IP address to connect to and attempt to keep the connection open. This option can be set multiple times.
addnode.description: Add a node IP address to connect to and attempt to keep the connection open. This option can be set multiple times to add multiple nodes. Connections are limited to 8 at a time and are counted separately from the -maxconnections limit.

asmap.name: ASN Mapping
asmap.description: Specify asn mapping used for bucketing of the peers. Relative paths will be prefixed by the net-specific datadir location.

bantime.name: Peer Ban Time
bantime.description: Default duration (in seconds) of manually configured bans.

bind.name: Bind to IP Address
bind.description: Bind to given address and always listen on it (default: 0.0.0.0). Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Append =onion to tag any incoming connections to that address and port as incoming Tor connections. (default: 127.0.0.1:8334=onion, testnet3: 127.0.0.1:18334=onion, testnet4: 127.0.0.1:18334=onion, signet: 127.0.0.1:38334=onion, regtest: 127.0.0.1:18445=onion.

cjdnsreachable.name: CJDNS Reachable
cjdnsreachable.description: If set, then this host is configured for CJDNS (connecting to fc00::/8 addresses would lead us to the CJDNS network)

connect.name: Only Connect to Peer
connect.shortDescription: Connect only to the specified node(s); can be set multiple times. -noconnect disables automatic connections.
connect.description: Connect only to the specified node(s); can be set multiple times. -noconnect disables automatic connections (the rules for this peer are the same as for -addnode).

discover.name: Discover IP Address
discover.description: Discover own IP addresses. If disabled, should be used with -externalip or -proxy.

externalip.name: External IP Address
externalip.description: Specify your own public IP address.

dns.name: Allow DNS Lookups
dns.description: Allow DNS lookups for -addnode, -seednode and -connect values.

dnsseed.name: Use DNS Seed
dnsseed.description: Query for peer addresses via DNS lookup, if low on addresses (default: 1 unless -connect used or -maxconnections=0).

fixedseeds.name: Use Fixed Seeds
fixedseeds.description: Allow fixed seeds if DNS seeds don't provide peers.

forcednsseed.name: Force DNS Seed
forcednsseed.description: Always query for peer addresses via DNS lookup.

feefilter.name: Fee filter
feefilter.description: Tell other nodes to filter invs to us by our mempool min fee.

i2pacceptincoming.name: Accept Incoming I2P Connections
i2pacceptincoming.shortDescription: Whether to accept inbound I2P connections. Ignored if -i2psam is not set.
i2pacceptincoming.description: Whether to accept inbound I2P connections. Ignored if -i2psam is not set. Listening for incoming I2P connections is done through the SAM proxy, not by binding to a local address and port.

i2psam.name: I2P SAM Proxy
i2psam.description: I2P SAM proxy <ip:port> to reach I2P peers and accept I2P connections.

listen.name: Listen for Incoming Connections
listen.description: Accept connections from outside (default: 1 if no -proxy, -connect or -maxconnection=0)

maxconnections.name: Max Peer Connections
maxconnections.shortDescription: Maintain at most N automatic connections to peers.
maxconnections.description: Maintain at most N automatic connections to peers. This limit does not apply to connections manually added via -addnode or the addnode RPC, which have a separate limit of 8.

natpmp.name: NAT Port Mapping Protocol
natpmp.description: Use NAT-PMP to map the listening port.

onion.name: Tor Proxy
onion.shortDescription: Use separate SOCKS5 proxy <ip:port|path> to reach peers via Tor hidden services.
onion.description: Use separate SOCKS5 proxy <ip:port|path> to reach peers via Tor hidden services. Set -noonion to disable (default: -proxy). May be a local file path prefixed with 'unix:'.

onlynet.name: Only Use Specific Network
onlynet.description: Make automatic outbound connections only to the selected network. Inbound and manual connections are not affected by this option. It can be specified multiple times to allow multiple networks.

valueDescriptions.ipv4: Only connect to peers via IPV4.
valueDescriptions.ipv6: Only connect to peers via IPV6.
valueDescriptions.onion: Only connect to peers via Tor.
valueDescriptions.i2p: Only connect to peers via I2P.
valueDescriptions.cjdns: Only connect to peers via CJDNS.

v2onlyclearnet.name: v2 Only Clearnet
v2onlyclearnet.shortDescription: Disallow outbound v1 connections on IPV4/IPV6.
v2onlyclearnet.description: Disallow outbound v1 connections on IPV4/IPV6. Enable this option only if you really need it. Use -listen=0 to disable inbound connections since they can be unencrypted.

peerblockfilters.name: Permit Peer Block Filters
peerblockfilters.description: Serve compact block filters to peers per BIP 157. NOTE: enabling this will force blockfilterindex on

peerbloomfilters.name: Permit Peer Bloom Filters
peerbloomfilters.description: Support filtering of blocks and transactions with bloom filters.

peertimeout.name: Peer Timeout
peertimeout.description: Specify p2p connection timeout in seconds. After connecting to a peer, wait this amount of time before considering disconnection based on inactivity.

port.name: Listen Port
port.shortDescription: Listen for incoming connections on non-default port. Defaults: (default: 8333, testnet3: 18333, testnet4: 48333, signet: 38333, regtest: 18444).
port.description: Listen for incoming connections on non-default port. Defaults: (default: 8333, testnet: 18333, signet: 38333, regtest: 18444). Not relevant for I2P. If set to a value x, the default onion listening port will be set to x+1.

proxy.name: Proxy Connection
proxy.shortDescription: Connect through <ip:port|path> SOCKS5 proxy, set -noproxy to disable.
proxy.description: Connect through <ip:port|path> SOCKS5 proxy, set -noproxy to disable. May be a local file path prefixed with 'unix:' if the proxy supports it.

proxyrandomize.name: Randomize Proxy
proxyrandomize.description: Randomize credentials for every proxy connection. This enables Tor stream isolation.

seednode.name: Seed Node
seednode.shortDescription: Connect to a node (IP address) to retrieve peer addresses, then disconnect. Can be specified multiple times.
seednode.description: Connect to a node (IP address) to retrieve peer addresses, then disconnect. This option can be specified multiple times to connect to multiple nodes. During startup, seed nodes will be tried before DNS seeds.

timeout.name: Connection Timeout
timeout.description: Initial peer connection timeout in milliseconds. If an initial attempt to connect is unsuccessful after this amount of time, drop it.

torcontrol.name: Tor Control
torcontrol.description: Tor control <ip:port> to use if onion listening enabled. If no port is specified, the default port of 9051 will be used.

uaappend.name: User Agent Append
uaappend.description: Append literal to the user agent string (should only be used for software embedding).

upnp.name: Universal Plug 'n Play
upnp.description: Use UPnP to map the listening port.

whitebind.name: Whitelist Bound IP Address
whitebind.shortDescription: Bind to the given address and add permission flags <[permissions@]addr> to the peers connecting to it. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Allowed permissions: bloomfilter, blockfilters, noban, forcerelay, relay, mempool, download, addr, forceinbound. Specify multiple permissions separated by commas (default: download,noban,mempool,relay). Can be specified multiple times.
whitebind.description: Bind to the given address and add permission flags <[permissions@]addr> to the peers connecting to it. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Allowed permissions: bloomfilter (allow requesting BIP37 filtered blocks and transactions), blockfilters (serve compact block filters to peers per BIP157), noban (do not ban for misbehavior; implies download), forcerelay (relay transactions that are already in the mempool; implies relay), relay (relay even in -blocksonly mode, and unlimited transaction announcements), mempool (allow requesting BIP35 mempool contents), download (allow getheaders during IBD, no disconnect after maxuploadtarget limit), addr (responses to GETADDR avoid hitting the cache and contain random records with the most up-to-date info), forceinbound (when connections are full, attempt to evict a random unprotected inbound peer to open a slot; implies noban). Specify multiple permissions separated by commas (default: download,noban,mempool,relay). Can be specified multiple times.

whitelist.name: Whitelist Peer
whitelist.description: Add permission flags <[permissions@]IP address or network> to the peers using the given IP address (e.g. 1.2.3.4) or CIDR-notated network (e.g. 1.2.3.0/24). Uses the same permissions as -whitebind. Additional flags "in" and "out" control whether permissions apply to incoming connections and/or outgoing (default: incoming only). Can be specified multiple times.

maxuploadtarget.name: Max Upload Target
maxuploadtarget.shortDescription: Tries to keep outbound traffic under the given target (in MiB per 24h). 0 = no limit.
maxuploadtarget.description: Tries to keep outbound traffic under the given target (in MiB per 24h). Limit does not apply to peers with 'download' permission or blocks created within past week. 0 = no limit (default: 0M). Optional suffix units [k|K|m|M|g|G|t|T] (default: M). Lowercase is 1000 base while uppercase is 1024 base.

mining.description: Configure attributes of blocks that can be mined by this node.

blockmaxsize.name: Max Block Size
blockmaxsize.description: Set maximum block size in bytes.

blockmintxfee.name: Block Min Transaction Fee
blockmintxfee.description: Set lowest fee rate (in BTC/kB) for transactions to be included in block creation.

blockprioritysize.name: Block Priority Size
blockprioritysize.description: Set maximum size of high-priority/low-fee transactions in bytes.

blockversion.name: Block Version
blockversion.description: Override block version to test forking scenarios.

rpc.description: Configure security and performance options for accessing the node's RPC interface.

deprecatedrpc.name: Enable Deprecated RPC Commands
deprecatedrpc.description: Allows deprecated RPC method(s) to be used.

server.name: Enable RPC Server
server.description: Accept command line and JSON-RPC commands.

rpcbind.name: Bind RPC Address
rpcbind.shortDescription: Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. This option is ignored unless -rpcallowip is also passed. Port is optional and overrides -rpcport. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. This option can be specified multiple times. (default: 127.0.0.1 and ::1 i.e., localhost)
rpcbind.description: Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. Do not expose the RPC server to untrusted networks such as the public internet! This option is ignored unless -rpcallowip is also passed. Port is optional and overrides -rpcport. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. This option can be specified multiple times. (default: 127.0.0.1 and ::1 i.e., localhost)

rpcdoccheck.name: RPC Documentation Check
rpcdoccheck.description: Throw a non-fatal error at runtime if the documentation for an RPC is incorrect.

rpccookiefile.name: RPC Cookie Directory
rpccookiefile.description: Location of the RPC auth cookie. Relative paths will be prefixed by a net-specific datadir location.

rpccookieperms.name: RPC Cookie Permissions
rpccookieperms.description: Set the permissions on the RPC auth cookie file so that it is readable by [owner|group|all] (default: owner [via umask 0077]).

valueDescriptions.owner: RPC auth cookie file is readable by owner.
valueDescriptions.group: RPC auth cookie file is readable by group.
valueDescriptions.all: RPC auth cookie file is readable by all users.

rpcauth.name: RPC Auth
rpcauth.shortDescription: Username and HMAC-SHA-256 hashed password for JSON-RPC connections, to be provided in the format: <userpw>[:wallet]. The field <userpw> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<SALT>$<HASH>. The client then connects normally using the rpcuser=<USERNAME>/rpcpassword=<PASSWORD> pair of arguments. A single wallet name can also be specified to restrict access to only that wallet, or '-' to deny all wallet access. Can be specified multiple times.
rpcauth.description: Username and HMAC-SHA-256 hashed password for JSON-RPC connections, to be provided in the format: <userpw>[:wallet]. The field <userpw> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<SALT>$<HASH>. A canonical python script is included in share/rpcauth. The client then connects normally using the rpcuser=<USERNAME>/rpcpassword=<PASSWORD> pair of arguments. A single wallet name can also be specified to restrict access to only that wallet, or '-' to deny all wallet access. You can generate this value at https://jlopp.github.io/bitcoin-core-rpc-auth-generator/. This option can be specified multiple times.

rpcauthfile.name: RPC Auth File
rpcauthfile.description: A file with a single line with the same format as rpcauth. This option can be specified multiple times.

rpcport.name: RPC Port
rpcport.description: Listen for JSON-RPC connections on this port (default: 8332, testnet3: 18332, testnet4: 48332, signet: 38332, regtest: 18443).

rpcallowip.name: RPC Allow IP Address
rpcallowip.description: Allow JSON-RPC connections from specified source. Valid for <ip> are a single IP (e.g. 1.2.3.4), a network/netmask (e.g. 1.2.3.4/255.255.255.0) a network/CIDR (e.g. 1.2.3.4/24), all ipv4 (0.0.0.0/0), or all ipv6 (::/0).. This option can be specified multiple times.

rpcwhitelistdefault.name: RPC Whitelist Default
rpcwhitelistdefault.description: Sets default behavior for rpc whitelisting. Unless set to 0, if any -rpcwhitelist is set, the rpc server acts as if all rpc users are subject to empty-unless-otherwise-specified whitelists. If set to 1 and no -rpcwhitelist is set, rpc server acts as if all rpc users are subject to empty whitelists.

rpcwhitelist.name: RPC Whitelist
rpcwhitelist.shortDescription: Set a whitelist to filter incoming RPC calls for a specific user. The field <whitelist> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<rpc 1>,<rpc 2>,...,<rpc n>. If multiple whitelists are set for a given user, they are set-intersected.
rpcwhitelist.description: Set a whitelist to filter incoming RPC calls for a specific user. The field <whitelist> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<rpc 1>,<rpc 2>,...,<rpc n>. If multiple whitelists are set for a given user, they are set-intersected. See -rpcwhitelistdefault documentation for information on default whitelist behavior.

rpcthreads.name: RPC Threads
rpcthreads.description: Set the number of threads to service RPC calls

rpcworkqueue.name: RPC Work Queue Size
rpcworkqueue.description: Set the depth of the work queue to service RPC calls

rpcservertimeout.name: RPC Timeout
rpcservertimeout.description: Number of seconds after which an uncompleted RPC call will time out

wallet.description: Configure behavior of the node's wallet.

addresstype.name: Address Type
addresstype.description: What type of addresses to use.

avoidpartialspends.name: Avoid Partial Spends
avoidpartialspends.shortDescription: Group outputs by address, selecting all or none, instead of selecting on a per-output basis. Improves privacy at expense of higher transaction fees.
avoidpartialspends.description: Group outputs by address, selecting many (possibly all) or none, instead of selecting on a per-output basis. Privacy is improved as addresses are mostly swept with fewer transactions and outputs are aggregated in clean change addresses. It may result in higher fees due to less optimal coin selection caused by this added limitation and possibly a larger-than-necessary number of inputs being used. Always enabled for wallets with "avoid_reuse" enabled, otherwise.

changetype.name: Change Address Type
changetype.description: What type of change address to use. Default is "legacy" when -addresstype=legacy, else it is an implementation detail.

valueDescriptions.p2sh-segwit: Use P2SH Wrapped SegWit change addresses.

consolidatefeerate.name: Consolidate Fee Rate
consolidatefeerate.description: The maximum feerate (in BTC/kvB) at which transaction building may use more inputs than strictly necessary so that the wallet's UTXO pool can be reduced

disablewallet.name: Disable Wallet
disablewallet.description: Do not load the wallet and disable wallet RPC calls.

keypool.name: Key Pool Size
keypool.description: Set key pool size to <n>. Warning: Smaller sizes may increase the risk of losing funds when restoring from an old backup, if none of the addresses in the original keypool have been used.

fallbackfee.name: Fallback Transaction Fee
fallbackfee.description: A fee rate (in BTC/kB) that will be used when fee estimation has insufficient data. 0 to entirely disable the fallbackfee feature.

discardfee.name: Discard Change Fee
discardfee.description: The fee rate (in BTC/kB) that indicates your tolerance for discarding change by adding it to the fee.

maxapsfee.name: Max Avoid Partial Spend Fee
maxapsfee.description: Spend up to this amount in additional (absolute) fees (in BTC) if it allows the use of partial spend avoidance.

mintxfee.name: Min Transaction Fee
mintxfee.description: Fee rates (in BTC/kB) smaller than this are considered zero fee for transaction creation.

paytxfee.name: Pay Transaction Fee
paytxfee.shortDescription: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) to add to transactions you send.
paytxfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) to add to transactions you send. Not recommended to set!

spendzeroconfchange.name: Spend Unconfirmed Change
spendzeroconfchange.description: Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions.

rootcertificates.name: Root Certificate file
rootcertificates.description: Specify a custom root certificate to trust for payment requests. Delete value to disable trusting root certificates.

txconfirmtarget.name: Transaction Fee Confirmation Target
txconfirmtarget.description: If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so that transactions begin confirmation on average within <n> blocks

unsafesqlitesync.name: Unsafe SQL Lite Sync
unsafesqlitesync.shortDescription: Set SQLite synchronous=OFF to disable waiting for the database to sync to disk.
unsafesqlitesync.description: Set SQLite synchronous=OFF to disable waiting for the database to sync to disk. This is unsafe and can cause data loss and corruption. This option is only used by tests to improve their performance.

walletrbf.name: Enable Replace By Fee Transactions
walletrbf.description: Send transactions with full-RBF opt-in enabled (RPC only).

wallet.name: Wallet Path
wallet.shortDescription: Specify wallet path to load at startup. Can be used multiple times to load multiple wallets. If the path is not absolute, it is interpreted relative to <walletdir>.
wallet.description: Specify wallet path to load at startup. Can be used multiple times to load multiple wallets. Path is to a directory containing wallet data and log files. If the path is not absolute, it is interpreted relative to <walletdir>. This only loads existing wallets and does not create new ones. For backwards compatibility this also accepts names of existing top-level data files in <walletdir>.

walletimplicitsegwit.name: Wallet Implicit Segwit
walletimplicitsegwit.description: Support segwit when restoring wallet backups and importing keys.

walletnotify.name: Wallet Notification
walletnotify.shortDescription: Execute command when a wallet transaction changes. Replacements: %s = TxID, %w = wallet name, %b = hash of the block including the transaction (set to 'unconfirmed' if the transaction is not included), %h = block height (-1 if not included).
walletnotify.description: Execute command when a wallet transaction changes. %s in cmd is replaced by TxID, %w is replaced by wallet name, %b is replaced by the hash of the block including the transaction (set to 'unconfirmed' if the transaction is not included) and %h is replaced by the block height (-1 if not included). %w should NOT be quoted because this would break shell escaping used to invoke the command.

dblogsize.name: DB Log Size
dblogsize.description: Flush wallet database activity from memory to disk log every <n> megabytes

flushwallet.name: Flush Wallet Automatically
flushwallet.description: Run a thread to flush wallet periodically.

privdb.name: Private DB
privdb.description: Set the DB_PRIVATE flag in the wallet db environment.

swapbdbendian.name: Swap DB Endianness
swapbdbendian.description: Swaps the internal endianness of BDB wallet databases.

walletrejectlongchains.name: Reject Long Transaction Chains
walletrejectlongchains.description: Wallet will not create transactions that violate mempool chain limits.

walletcrosschain.name: Wallet Cross Chain
walletcrosschain.description: Allow reusing wallet files across chains.

zeromq.description: Options for handling notifications emitted via ZeroMQ.

zmqpubhashblock.name: Publish Block Hashes
zmqpubhashblock.description: Enable publishing of block hashes to <address>.

zmqpubhashtx.name: Publish Transaction Hashes
zmqpubhashtx.description: Enable publishing of transaction hashes to <address>.

zmqpubhashwallettx.name: Publish Wallet Transaction Hashes
zmqpubhashwallettx.description: Enable publishing of wallet transaction hashes to <address>.

zmqpubrawblock.name: Publish Raw Blocks
zmqpubrawblock.description: Enable publishing of raw block hex to <address>.

zmqpubrawtx.name: Publish Raw Transactions
zmqpubrawtx.description: Enable publishing of raw transaction hex to <address>.

zmqpubrawwallettx.name: Publish Raw Wallet Transaction
zmqpubrawwallettx.description: Enable publishing of raw wallet transaction hex to <address>.

zmqpubsequence.name: Publish Hash Block and Transaction Sequence
zmqpubsequence.description: Enable publish hash block and tx sequence in <address>.

zmqpubhashblockhwm.name: Publish Block Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubhashblockhwm.description: Set publish hash block outbound message high water mark.

zmqpubhashtxhwm.name: Publish Transaction Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubhashtxhwm.description: Set publish hash transaction outbound message high water mark.

zmqpubhashwallettxhwm.name: Publish Wallet Transaction Hashes High Water Mark
zmqpubhashwallettxhwm.description: Set publish hash wallet transaction outbound message high water mark.

zmqpubrawblockhwm.name: Publish Raw Blocks High Water Mark
zmqpubrawblockhwm.description: Set publish raw block outbound message high water mark.

zmqpubrawtxhwm.name: Publish Raw Transactions High Water Mark
zmqpubrawtxhwm.description: Set publish raw transaction outbound message high water mark.

zmqpubrawwallettxhwm.name: Publish Raw Wallet Transactions High Water Mark
zmqpubrawwallettxhwm.description: Set publish raw wallet transaction outbound message high water mark.

zmqpubsequencehwm.name: Publish Hash Sequence Message High Water Mark
zmqpubsequencehwm.description: Set publish hash sequence message high water mark.

statsmaxmemorytarget.name: Statistics Maximum Memory Target
statsmaxmemorytarget.description: Set the memory limit target for statistics in bytes.
